poem:
Title: Testament of the Pea

In humble pods we slept, beneath a Basque moon,
nurture gold with the maternal thumb.
Young trebles of verdant notes, blooming on a kitchen scene,
in our humble forthcomings, we enrich the serene.
Identity tendered in the minuet of peas;
These are our morsels of memory, and silently, we feed.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative.
